did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: File folders contain historical information, relating to the town of Winchester and the city of Winsted, about local individuals and families.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Beardsley and Memorial Library.

bioghist.head: History
bioghist.p: The files have been compiled by the Beardsley Library from primary and secondary sources to document individual and family histories related to Winsted, Connecticut. Settled in 1750, the city of Winsted was formed at the junction of the Mad River and Still River, and was one of the first mill towns in Connecticut. The city is within the town of Winchester, and its name derives from the fact that it is the business center for the towns of Winchester and Barkhamsted.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The files contain biographies, correspondence, documents, genealogies, newspaper articles, obituaries, photographs, etc. pertaining to local individuals and families in the town of Winchester and the city of Winsted. Families documented include: Beach, Beardsley, Clarke, Coe, DeMars, Gilbert, Horne, Moore, Pinney, Rockwell, Strong, and Tuttle.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Materials are in hanging file folders, in a file cabinet, and are arranged in alphabetical order by surnames.
